TopicTitle: Help in a Minecraft error report

Articles.Content:
Haven't posting here for a long time, but now I need help!

Here is the blog I made for the help: http://needhelpinminecraftblog.blogspot.com

If you're willing to help, go to the link and email me.

Thanks if you helped me.
A lot more information is needed than just that, if someone is going to help you. Things like when the problem occurs, what you changed before and tried after, and more are important to know.
Ok, I'll add more info about my "MC won't launch" problem. I'll post again after I edited my blog post.
Done. I added more info. So, please help me in this.

Were you trying to launch a plain vanilla 1.7.10 profile?

- If yes: Did the game generate a crash report? (to be found in the game install folder, accessible via the launcher's profile editor if you don't know how to find it manually)

- If no: try newly creating and launching a plain vanilla 1.7.10 profile.

Never mind it. It worked today. Idk why it won't launch yesterday. But still, please look at it.

[EDITED] I'm sorry. Now, my problem is that I can't join any server and I can't play a singleplayer world. I'll try digging through it.

Edited August 26, 2014 by RocketScientist00
I spoke too soon
I edited the post now. This would work nicely to solve the problem.

Still no word on the various solutions you tried to fix the problem. Did you reinstall Java and Minecraft? Did you change anything before the problem occurred that might have something to do with it?

I am sorry, but without much effort or input on your side, no one is going to help you. Or even going to be able to help you.

Yes, I tried to reinstall Java and Minecraft dude. I tried to uninstall Java SDK that I installed before this happened. But, nothing happened. I think the report is a Java crash. I totally need to do something.
NVM. I relaunched Minecraft now. I think the cause is the Java 8 Update 20 installed. I uninstalled it and Minecraft launched like magic!!! Thanks for trying anyways. Somebody close this thread.
